column4: help...Dell laptop was fine, now no grub, just tty1! Tried Googling, but no luck. help!
did you recently run updates?
yes. friend laptop, but he even asked me if he should run it.
did it work after the updates, or are the updates what broke it?
You get a non-graphical login prompt? Can you log into it?
can you log in at the prompt and then type "gdm" and see what happens?
giving it a shot now...give me a moment
my guess is that your video drivers got screwed up and that X is failing to start
here's the error I get "** (gdm-binary:1760): WARNING ** Failed to acquire org.DisplayManager; could not acquire name; bailing out"
that was run as SUDO
what about without sudo?
is there any way to copy the drivers/files/etc from the LiveCD to a mounted HD, and make it work?
unlikely. I think you need to fix X and GDM
try running gdmsetup or sudo gdmsetup from command line
great! "(gdmsetup:1932): Gtk-WARNING **: cannot open display"
did it run, or did it fail with that error?
was the upgrade your friend did a distro upgrade or just a regular update?
regular update...why this is so weird.
is there any chance he shut down before the upgrade was finished? Because it looks like it's pretty seriously hosed.
idk. other options before I Live-boot, copy his files, and reinstall the OS?
That might be faster. If you're comfortable with the command line you can back up his /home/hisname directory to a USB drive and reinstall
THNX! I appreciate you taking some time!
sorry I couldn't actually help :(
